# multilevelcoda

## Overview

This package provides functions to model compositional data in a
multilevel framework using full Bayesian inference. It integrates the
principes of Compositional Data Analysis (CoDA) and Multilevel Modelling
and supports both compositional data as an outcome and predictors in a
wide range of generalized (non-)linear multivariate multilevel models.

## Installation

To install the latest release version from CRAN, run

``` r
install.packages("multilevelcoda")
```

The current developmental version can be downloaded from github via

``` r
if (!requireNamespace("remotes")) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}
remotes::install_github("florale/multilevelcoda")
```

Because multilevelcoda is built on brms, which is based on Stan, a C++
compiler is required. The program Rtools (available on
<https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/Rtools/>) comes with a C++
compiler for Windows. On Mac, Xcode is required. For further
instructions on how to get the compilers running, see the prerequisites
section on
<https://github.com/stan-dev/rstan/wiki/RStan-Getting-Started>.

## Resources

You can learn about the package from these vignettes:

- [Introduction to Compositional Multilevel
  Modelling](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/A-introduction.html)
- [Multilevel Models with Compositional
  Predictors](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/B-composition-MLM.html)
- [Multilevel Models with Compositional
  Outcome](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/C-composition-MMLM.html)
- [Compositional Substitution Multilevel
  Analysis](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/D-substitution.html)

## Citing `multilevelcoda` and related software

When using multilevelcoda, please cite one or more of the following
publications:

- Le, F., Stanford, T. E., Dumuid, D., & Wiley, J. F. (2025). Bayesian
  multilevel compositional data analysis: introduction, evaluation, and
  application. *Psychological Methods*.
  <https://doi.org/10.1037/met0000750>
- Le F., Dumuid D., Stanford T. E., Wiley J. F. (2025). Bayesian
  multilevel compositional data analysis with the R package
  multilevelcoda. *Multivariate Behavioral Research*.
  <https://doi.org/10.1080/00273171.2025.2565598>

As multilevelcoda depends on brms and Stan, please also consider citing:

- Bürkner P. C. (2017). brms: An R Package for Bayesian Multilevel
  Models using Stan. *Journal of Statistical Software*. 80(1), 1-28.
  doi.org/10.18637/jss.v080.i01
- Bürkner P. C. (2018). Advanced Bayesian Multilevel Modeling with the R
  Package brms. *The R Journal*. 10(1), 395-411.
  doi.org/10.32614/RJ-2018-017
- Bürkner P. C. (2021). Bayesian Item Response Modeling in R with brms
  and Stan. *Journal of Statistical Software*, 100(5), 1-54.
  doi.org/10.18637/jss.v100.i05
- Stan Development Team. YEAR. Stan Modeling Language Users Guide and
  Reference Manual, VERSION. <https://mc-stan.org>
- Carpenter B., Gelman A., Hoffman M. D., Lee D., Goodrich B.,
  Betancourt M., Brubaker M., Guo J., Li P., and Riddell A. (2017).
  Stan: A probabilistic programming language. *Journal of Statistical
  Software*. 76(1). doi.org/10.18637/jss.v076.i01

# Package index

## All functions

- [`VarCorr(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/VarCorr.brmcoda.md)
  : Extract Variance and Correlation Components

- [`as.data.frame(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/as.data.frame.complr.md)
  [`as.matrix(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/as.data.frame.complr.md)
  : Extract amounts and compositions in conventional formats as
  data.frames, matrices, or arrays.

- [`bayes_factor(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/bayes_factor.brmcoda.md)
  : Bayes Factors from Marginal Likelihoods

- [`brmcoda()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/brmcoda.md)
  : Fit Bayesian generalised (non-)linear multilevel compositional model
  via full Bayesian inference

- [`bsub()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/bsub.md)
  : Between-person Simple Substitution

- [`bsubmargin()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/bsubmargin.md)
  : Between-person Average Substitution

- [`build.base()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/build.base.md)
  : Build Base Pairwise Substitution

- [`build.rg()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/build.rg.md)
  :

  Reference Grid for `substitution` model.

- [`build.sbp()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/build.sbp.md)
  : Build Sequential Binary Partition

- [`coef(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/coef.brmcoda.md)
  : Model Coefficients

- [`compilr()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/compilr.md)
  : Indices from a (dataset of) Multilevel Composition(s) (deprecated.)

- [`complr()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/complr.md)
  : Indices from a (dataset of) Multilevel Composition(s)

- [`log_posterior(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/diagnostic-quantities-brmcoda.md)
  [`nuts_params(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/diagnostic-quantities-brmcoda.md)
  [`rhat(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/diagnostic-quantities-brmcoda.md)
  [`neff_ratio(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/diagnostic-quantities-brmcoda.md)
  :

  Extract Diagnostic Quantities from `brmsfit` Models in `brmcoda`

- [`variables(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/draws-index-brmcoda.md)
  [`nvariables(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/draws-index-brmcoda.md)
  [`niterations(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/draws-index-brmcoda.md)
  [`nchains(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/draws-index-brmcoda.md)
  [`ndraws(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/draws-index-brmcoda.md)
  :

  Index `brmcoda` objects

- [`fitted(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/fitted.brmcoda.md)
  : Expected Values of the Posterior Predictive Distribution

- [`fixef(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/fixef.brmcoda.md)
  : Population-Level Estimates

- [`get-substitution`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/get-substitution.md)
  : Substitution analysis helper functions

- [`get_sbp()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/get_sbp.md)
  :

  Extract Sequential Binary Partition from a `complr` object.

- [`get_variables()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/get_variables.md)
  : Extract variable names from an object

- [`is.brmcoda()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/is.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Checks if argument is a `brmcoda` object

- [`is.complr()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/is.complr.md)
  :

  Checks if argument is a `complr` object

- [`is.substitution()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/is.substitution.md)
  :

  Checks if argument is a `substitution` object

- [`launch_shinystan(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/launch_shinystan.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Interface to shinystan

- [`loo(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/loo.brmcoda.md)
  : Efficient approximate leave-one-out cross-validation (LOO)

- [`mcmc_plot(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/mcmc_plot.brmcoda.md)
  :

  MCMC Plots Implemented in bayesplot

- [`mcompd`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/mcompd.md)
  : Multilevel Compositional Data

- [`mean(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/mean.complr.md)
  :

  Mean amounts and mean compositions presented in a `complr` object.

- [`model.frame(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/model.frame.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Extracting the Model Frame from a Formula or Fit from `brmcoda` object

- [`multilevelcoda_sim()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/multilevelcoda_sim.md)
  : multilevelcoda Simulation Study Results

- [`nobs(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/nobs.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Extract Number of Observations from `brmcoda` object

- [`pairs(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/pairs.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Create a matrix of output plots from a `brmcoda`'s
  [`brmsfit`](https://paulbuerkner.com/brms/reference/brmsfit-class.html)
  object

- [`pivot_coord()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/pivot_coord.md)
  : Estimate pivot balance coordinates

- [`pivot_coord_refit()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/pivot_coord_refit.md)
  : Estimate pivot balance coordinates by refitting model.

- [`pivot_coord_rotate()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/pivot_coord_rotate.md)
  : Estimate pivot balance coordinates by rotating sequential binary
  partition.

- [`plot(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/plot.brmcoda.md)
  : Trace and Density Plots for MCMC Draws plot

- [`plot(`*`<substitution>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/plot.substitution.md)
  : Substitution Plot

- [`pp_check(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/pp_check.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Posterior Predictive Checks for `brmcoda` Objects

- [`predict(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/predict.brmcoda.md)
  : Draws from the Posterior Predictive Distribution

- [`print(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/print.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Print a Summary for a fitted `brmsfit` model in a `brmcoda` object

- [`print(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/print.complr.md)
  :

  Print a Summary for a `complr` object

- [`print(`*`<substitution>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/print.substitution.md)
  :

  Print a Summary for a `substitution` object

- [`prior_summary(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/prior_summary.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Extract Priors of a `brmsfit` from a `brmcoda` object

- [`psub`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/psub.md) :
  Possible Pairwise Substitutions

- [`ranef(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/ranef.brmcoda.md)
  : Group-Level Estimates

- [`residuals(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/residuals.brmcoda.md)
  : Posterior Draws of Residuals/Predictive Errors

- [`sbp`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/sbp.md) :
  Sequential Binary Partition

- [`sim`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/sim.md) :
  multilevelcoda Simulation Study results

- [`sub()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/sub.md) :
  Simple Substitution

- [`submargin()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/submargin.md)
  : Average Substitution

- [`substitution()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/substitution.md)
  : Multilevel Compositional Substitution Analysis

- [`summary(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/summary.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Create a Summary of a fitted `brmsfit` model in a `brmcoda` object

- [`summary(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/summary.complr.md)
  :

  Create a Summary of a `complr` object

- [`summary(`*`<pivot_coord>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/summary.pivot_coord.md)
  :

  Create a Summary of a fitted `brmsfit` model from a `pivot_coord`
  object

- [`summary(`*`<substitution>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/summary.substitution.md)
  :

  Create a Summary of a Substitution Model represented by a
  `substitution` object

- [`update(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/update.brmcoda.md)
  :

  Update `brmcoda` models

- [`var(`*`<complr>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/var.complr.md)
  :

  Variance of compositions presented in a `complr` object.

- [`vcov(`*`<brmcoda>`*`)`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/vcov.brmcoda.md)
  : Covariance and Correlation Matrix of Population-Level Effects

- [`wsub()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/wsub.md)
  : Within-person Simple Substitution

- [`wsubmargin()`](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/reference/wsubmargin.md)
  : Within-person Average Substitution

# Articles

### Vignettes

- [Introduction to Bayesian Compositional Multilevel
  Modelling](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/A-introduction.md):
- [Multilevel Models with Compositional
  Predictors](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/B-composition-MLM.md):
- [Multilevel Model with Compositional
  Outcomes](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/C-composition-MMLM.md):
- [Compositional Substitution Multilevel
  Analysis](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/D-substitution.md):
- [Improving MCMC Sampling for Bayesian Compositional Multilevel
  Models](https://florale.github.io/multilevelcoda/articles/E-simmodel-diag.md):
